p: We downloaded daily records of precipitation and temperature from the China Meteorological Data Sharing Service System ( http://cdc.nmic.cn/home.do). As low-temperature stress is common over the Tibetan Plateau, plants generally start to grow when it is warm. In addition to GSP, accumulated temperature when daily mean is over 5 °C (AccT) also accumulated 27. GSP and AccT in 2014 were firstly compiled from daily climatic raster surfaces that were interpolated using ANUSLPIN 4.3 55, and then extracted for each site in ArcGIS 10.2 (ERSI, Redlands, CA, USA). Finally, we accepted the ratio of GSP/AccT to describe the habitat moisture index (HMI = GSP/AccT) as did Wang, et al. 27. Soil variables, including soil organic carbon (SOC) and total nitrogen (STN) were extracted from Wu, et al. 51 and Li, et al. 56.
